title: Can a person living outside of the US submit his scripts (written in English) in the U.S.? How can I introduce my movie scripts to American agencies? - Quora

response.answer_text: Most would recommend various contests and other oportunities. You can go this way and submit script/treatment etc, depending on their requirements. Also yo can submit script to the agencies directly. Check the web, check the agencies, check the requirements - go for it. Third option - search for producers. Some might refuse, some would require agent but someone can be interested. Or just start production by yourself. Doesn’t matter which way you’ll go, basically you’ll need a lawyer. There could be tonns of nuances and complications, that require someone who do this for living and knows ins and outs.

Most agencies are already inundated with unsolicited scripts. They don’t take on clients that have not sold scripts or had them produced. They want to make money by helping you find buyers, but to do that they need to see you have a proven track record of already doing that. They are not a way in, they are a way to continue the career you have started. The best route for you is to look into film festivals that accept screenplays, win laurels, win other contests and when you are good enough, enter into the Nichol’s Fellowship run by the Academy (Oscars). Check out Film Festivals, Screenplay Contests, Submissions for international contests. Good luck.

Works the same way just don’t expect too much because it’s all about who you know and taking meetings. If you aren’t there you are never top of mind. Try winning some contests or making some American writing friends.
